channel.title: Torrents!
channel.description: im using u torrent and i wanteed to know if uploading takes up your download limit and if your uploading while downloading does it mean files are being sent from your computer or that you are uploading off someone else's computer?

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Upload is going from your computer to others. Hence, you are uploading.

Download is going from someone else’s to yours. Hence, you are downloading.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

so where it says upload speed its acctually giving files away from my computer or it it uploading files form someone elses computer to mine.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

gloats well on popular torrents ( like Axxo’s) I do because there is always soemone else to uplad for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I’m not an ass… I actually have a decent share ratio. And limiting it to 10 kbps has a marginal gain over limiting it to 100 kbps, if at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

My suggestion is throttling it to 10kbps. works even better for me

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I suggest you throttle your upload to 100 kbps, depending on your connection speed, because high uploads can choke your downloads.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrents!
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:163452”][quote author=sidishere link=topic=222135.msg1920948#msg1920948 date=1197176188]
im using u torrent and i wanteed to know if uploading takes up your download limit and if your uploading while downloading does it mean files are being sent from your computer or that you are uploading off someone else’s computer?
[/quote]
Files are uploaded, stored in the sites bandwidth, then downloaded by your computer, If i am correct.[/quote]

no… The whole point of torrenting is that there is no site needed ( except to download the .torrent file)

Someone has the file on there computer. they find some trackers and some other stuff and then upload it onto a popular torenting site ( thepiratebay.com for example) and then someone else can download that file. the .torrent file is really small, like less than 10kb then you open up your program ( such as µtorrent) and then you download the files from the seeder( anyone who has part of the pile that you want)

Read full topic
